subject: Re: [junit] Adding tests to existing code
msgSnippet: ... So true!  The samples file is up there now.  There were some changes before that went to production.  Nothing major that I remember.  The chapter I put up
messageBody:
J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

> Michael Feathers wrote:
>
> > J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
>
> > >
> > > Michael Feathers is completing a book entitled "Working
> Effectively with
> > > Legacy Code" which contains hundreds of pages of advice in this
> > > direction.
> >
> >
> > Thanks, J.B. I just received the book in my hands for the first time a
> > few days ago. Unfortunately, Amazon
> > doesn't have its description info yet, but we have a link on the Object
> > Mentor website:
> >
> > http://www.objectmentor.com/resources/bookstore/books/welc/
> >
> > I'll add a sample chapter to files section of this yahoo group too.
>
> Congratulations! What a great feeling, eh?
>

So true! The samples file is up there now. There were some changes
before that went to production. Nothing major that I remember. The
chapter I put up contains a bunch of different scenarios that show how
to instantiate difficult classes in test harnesses. The examples are in
Java, C++, and C#, but not terribly idiomatic. I hope you all find them
useful.

Michael Feathers
www.objectmentor.com
